4.1. Basic virus‐cell model Let V denote virions that enter a healthy target cell T changing this target cell into an infected one I, where the virus is capable of replication and release. We refer to this model as a TIV model, where there are two types of target cells, healthy and infected, and the virus particles or virions. This model has been extensively investigated with respect to human infectious diseases, in particular HIV‐1 (e.g., Nowak and May [2000], Perelson and Nelson [1999]).
